column4: im having a hard time connecting to anything from ubuntu (things keep timing out) but i have no problems on my windows machine on the same network, why would that happen?
like for instance, i can connect to some irc servers with ease, others time out repeatedly
things on the local network seem to be okay
its just the internet thats acting up
is it only irc?
please try something else than irc and web too
IRC lagging can be explained by not having an identd which currenyly most IRC servers require
Open firefox and go to about:config. Now search for network.dns.disableIPV6 and set that value to true. Restart Firefox to see the effect.
you might as well disable ipv6 completely, you can find out how on wiki.ubuntu.com
no it's the same on both in this case
for amd64 you'd better go to hoary
really try hoary then
try sudo ln -s /dev/hdc /dev/dvd (if hdc is your dvd player)
nice :)
is the cd drive listed in your /etc/fstab with the user and noauto options?
can you please post your /etc/fstab to paste.ubuntulinux.nl
/etc/fstab is a file
if /dev/hdc is your cdrom drive (secondary slave), this looks good
i pasted fstab
that all looks perfectly normal, what is the error you get?
gdmflexiserver --xnest
hmm, you should forget it anyway, nvm
mkfs can put a new filesystem on it (like format does on windows)
aptitude install nfs-kernel-server (nfs client is there already)
